p: Several randomized clinical trials (RCTs) are currently underway, not yet published, which are testing different therapies for COVID-19. One of the drugs, normally used in the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis, targets the interleukin 6 receptor and has been included in the COVID-19 treatment guidelines issued by the Chinese National Health Commission [ 33, 34]. In addition, several RCTs are underway regarding the use of antiviral drugs for the treatment of COVID-19 [ 32, 35â€“ 38]. Finally, a recent study evaluates the use of plasma from convalescent patients with previous SARS-CoV-2 infection as a potential therapeutic treatment [ 39]. Another study shows that the use of systemic corticosteroids for COVID-19 is not recommended [ 40].
